options.systemMessage:
You are Snowflake SQL assistant.

Use tools to retrieve data from Snowflake and answer user.

IMPORTANT Always check database schema and table definition for preparing SQL query.

parameters.toolDescription: Get list of all tables in database

parameters.query:
SELECT 
    column_name,
    data_type

FROM 
    SNOWFLAKE_SAMPLE_DATA.information_schema.columns
WHERE 
    table_name = '{{ $fromAI("table_name") }}'
    AND table_schema = 'TPCH_SF1'
ORDER BY 
    ordinal_position;
parameters.toolDescription: Get table definition to find all columns and types.

assignments.name: html

parameters.description:
Generate custom SQL queries using knowledge about DB schema and table definitions to provide needed response for user request.
Use ->> operator to extract JSON data.

Supported functions for big data analysis:
• GROUP BY – for grouping data
• SUM() – for summing values
• AVG() – for calculating averages
• COUNT() – for counting records
• MIN() – for finding the minimum value
• MAX() – for finding the maximum value
• MEDIAN() – for median calculation
• STDDEV() – for standard deviation
• VARIANCE() – for variance calculation
• PERCENTILE_CONT() – for percentile calculations
• MODE() – for most frequent value
• TREND() – for trend analysis over time
• WINDOW FUNCTIONS – for advanced analytics (e.g., ROW_NUMBER(), RANK(), PARTITION BY)

Query example:
SELECT * FROM FILES

assignments.name: html

parameters.content: ### Replace name of schema and database

![5min Logo](https://res.cloudinary.com/de9jgixzm/image/upload/Skool%20Assets/ejm3hqnvhgwpnu2fv92s)
## AI Agent to chat with Snowflake database with UI
**Made by [Mark Shcherbakov](https://www.linkedin.com/in/marklowcoding/) from community [5minAI](https://www.skool.com/5minai-pro)**

This workflow is designed for developers, data analysts, and business professionals who want to interact with their Snowflake data conversationally. It suits users looking to automate SQL query generation with AI, manage large datasets efficiently, and produce interactive reports without deep technical knowledge.

**Preparation**  
- Create your Snowflake credentials in n8n with required host and account details, warehouse (e.g., "computer_warehouse"), database, schema, username, and password.  
- Replace placeholder variables in schema retrieval workflows with your actual database and data source names.  
- Verify the credentials by testing the connection; reset passwords if needed.

### ... or watch set up video [5 min]
[![Youtube Thumbnail](https://res.cloudinary.com/de9jgixzm/image/upload/nvg4dvgajspjzqudh2wa)](https://youtu.be/r7er-HCRsX4)
